docs.lead_paragraph: An article on Tuesday about health insurance companies' switching to a new method of reimbursing out-of-network medical costs misstated part of the name of a patients' group. It is Advocacy for Patients With Chronic Illness (not Advocates). The error was repeated in some editions in a picture caption with the continuation of the article.
docs.snippet: An article on Tuesday about health insurance companies' switching to a new method of reimbursing out-of-network medical costs misstated part of the name of a patients' group. It is Advocacy for Patients With Chronic Illness (not Advocates). The error...

docs.lead_paragraph: Accusing the former state senator of being careless with the public’s trust, the prosecution delivers a partially mocking closing argument at the embezzlement trial.

headline.seo: Espada’s Fraud Trial Wrapping Up After Six Weeks
headline.main: Fraud Trial for Espada Is Concluding After 6 Weeks
headline.print_headline: Fraud Trial For Espada Is Concluding After 6 Weeks

docs.abstract: Federal prosecutors make closing arguments in fraud trial of Pedro Espada Jr, former New York State senator who is accused, along with his son Pedro Gautier Espada, of embezzling money from Bronx nonprofit Soundview Health Center; Espada and his son face maximum of 15 years in prison if convicted.
docs.snippet: Accusing the former state senator of being careless with the public’s trust, the prosecution delivers a partially mocking closing argument at the embezzlement trial.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Department of Veterans Affairs plans to increase its mental health staff by 10 percent, but questions remain about whether that will be enough.
docs.abstract: Editorial welcomes announcement by the Department of Veteran Affairs that it plans to increase its mental health staff by 10 percent; asserts more still needs to be done; urges Pres Obama and Democratic leaders to push back against efforts by Republicans in Congress to cut financial support for crucial programs for veterans.
docs.snippet: The Department of Veterans Affairs plans to increase its mental health staff by 10 percent, but questions remain about whether that will be enough.

docs.lead_paragraph: Disability insurance takes too many workers out of the job market prematurely. It reduces their lifetime income and, to top it off, slows economic growth.
docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column, prompted by publication of Social Security's annual financial report, says that disability insurance takes too many workers out of the job market prematurely, reduces their lifetime income and slows economic growth; contends that it is critical to fix problems with the nation's disability program but says it rarely receives the political attention it deserves.
docs.snippet: Disability insurance takes too many workers out of the job market prematurely. It reduces their lifetime income and, to top it off, slows economic growth.

docs.lead_paragraph: A residential complex in the Netherlands that tries to help dementia patients continue to lead a normal life has received attention as a model.

headline.seo: Hogewey Tries to Preserve Normal Lives for Dementia Patients
headline.main: Taking On Dementia With the Experiences of Normal Life
headline.print_headline: Taking On Dementia With the Experiences Of Normal Life

docs.abstract: Weesp Journal; Hogewey residential complex in the Netherlands has received international attention as a model for how to help dementia patients lead normal lives; Hogewey functions on the basic principle that those suffering from dementia will thrive if they are kept in familiar surroundings, remain active and are given as much freedom as possible.
docs.snippet: A residential complex in the Netherlands that tries to help dementia patients continue to lead a normal life has received attention as a model.

docs.lead_paragraph: A consulting actuary offers a “neat solution” to the problem.
docs.snippet: A consulting actuary offers a “neat solution” to the problem.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the United States’ largest medical debt-collection companies is under fire in Minnesota for placing employees in hospitals and demanding patients pay before receiving treatment, documents show.

headline.seo: Debt Collectors Take Places Alongside Hospital Staffs
headline.main: Debt Collector Is Faulted for Tough Tactics in Hospitals
headline.print_headline: Debt Collectors Pursue Patients Inside Hospitals

docs.abstract: Minnesota Atty Gen Lori Swanson releases documents from Accretive Health, one of the nation's largest medical debt collectors, that reveal the aggressive tactics the company employs, raising concerns that such practices have become common at hospitals across the country; the documents cast a spotlight on the increasingly desperate strategies among hospitals to recoup payments as outstanding debts mount.
docs.snippet: One of the United States’ largest medical debt-collection companies is under fire in Minnesota for placing employees in hospitals and demanding patients pay before receiving treatment, documents show.

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Paul D. Ryan, the Republican chairman of the House Budget Committee, has been excoriated by some Roman Catholic leaders ever since he claimed this month that his budget plan, which slashes antipoverty programs, was inspired by the moral teachings of his Catholic faith. The latest criticism comes in a letter released Tuesday and signed by nearly 90 faculty members and priests at Georgetown, the Jesuit university in Washington, in advance of Mr. Ryan's visit there on Thursday. Mr. Ryan is to deliver the prestigious Whittington Lecture, named for an associate dean who was killed on the airplane that crashed into the Pentagon on Sept. 11, 2001.

headline.main: Letter From Georgetown: A Jesuit Rebuke for Ryan

docs.abstract: Caucus column; Republican Rep Paul D Ryan of Wisconsin is criticized in a letter from faculty members and priests at Georgetown, the Jesuit university in Washington; letter objects to Ryan's position that his budget plan, which cuts antipoverty programs, was inspired by the teachings of his Catholic faith. (M)d
